results.title: Moana Roa
results.brief_description: Life among the Polynesian people who inhabit New Zealand’s Cook Islands. The sea plays an important part in the lives of these people; they are expert spear fisherman and gain much of their food from the sea; singing and dancing and also canoe racing are popular pastimes with the islanders. The film reviews health and educational services provided by the administration and mentions the exports of the Islands - copra, oranges, bananas and pineapples.

results.title: Mitosis. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: William L. Claiborne and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Defines the cellular process of mitosis. Identifies and illustrates the role of the cell nucleus, DNA, chromosomes, chromatids and the centriole in mitosis. Demonstrates the phases of mitosis and explains what happens during each phase. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Mitosis and mitotic poisons = Mitose und mitosegifte
results.creator_credit: Professor H Lette and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: Cultures are grown from the heart of a chicken embryo and the behaviour of the original and subcultures is shown. The process of cell division is photographed at a magnification of 250 and in more detail using oil-immersion at a magnification of 900. The inhibition of mitosis by the presence in the culture medium of various substances is studied. The action which inhibits mitosis varies from an adhesion of the chromosomes which are attempting to divide in the presence of trypaflavin to an explosion of the cells attempting division in the presence of adrenalin. Captions in German.

results.title: Mister Prime Minister: Robert Gordon Menzies
results.brief_description: Documents the life and political career of Sir Robert Menzies, Prime Minister of Australia during 1939-1941 and 1949-1966, shown in contemporary film scenes. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Mister prime minister: Alfred Deakin
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of Deakin’s life from his birth in a northern inner suburb of Melbourne in 1856 to his death in 1919, and closely examines his involvement in the Federation movement and his dominance of the first decade of Federal politics. Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: Miss, Mrs, or Ms: what's it all about?
results.brief_description: Reports on the progress being made by feminist philosophies, showing that the stereotyping of traditional roles is decreasing in American society. Narrated by: Sylvia Chase, Christopher Glenn.

results.title: Miss Nelson is missing (K)
results.creator_credit: Frank Gladstone, Richard Rosen, Learning Corporation of America and Synatrak
results.brief_description: Miss Nelson is the nicest teacher in the school but her students are the worst behaved. When she suddenly does not come to school, a substitute teacher, Miss Viola Swamp, appears instead. Miss Swamp immediately lays down the law - no talking, no goofing, no free time. The students immediately begin a search for Miss Nelson, realising how wonderful she really is. They get nowhere, and are grateful on the day Miss Nelson mysteriously reappears. Animated and based on the book by Harry Allard, illustrated by James Marshall.

results.title: Miss Goodall and the wild chimpanzees
results.brief_description: Describes Jane Goodall and her studies as she observes and records the behaviour of wild chimpanzees in a forest reserve near Lake Tanganyika in Africa. Shows the chimpanzees engaged in both individual and social activities. Narrated by Orson Welles
